## About This Book

This book is designed to help you master data structures and algorithms through hands-on problem solving. Each chapter focuses on a specific topic, starting with fundamental concepts and building up to more advanced problems.

## Table of Contents

1. [Introduction to Problem Solving](intro.qmd)
2. [Arrays](arrays/index.qmd)
   - Two Pointers Technique
   - Sliding Window Technique
3. [Strings](strings/index.qmd)
   - Anagrams & Frequency Counting
4. [Linked Lists](linked-lists/index.qmd)
5. [Stacks & Queues](stacks-queues/index.qmd)
6. [Trees](trees/index.qmd)
7. [Graphs](graphs/index.qmd)
8. [Sorting & Searching](sorting-searching/index.qmd)
9. [Dynamic Programming](dynamic-programming/index.qmd)

## How to Use This Book

- Each chapter includes:
  - Core concepts and theory
  - Visual explanations
  - Step-by-step problem solutions
  - Practice problems with solutions
  - Time and space complexity analysis

## Prerequisites

- Basic programming knowledge (Python preferred)
- Understanding of basic data types and control structures
- Familiarity with Big-O notation

## Getting Started

1. Clone the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/yourusername/dsa-book)
2. Install required dependencies: `pip install -r requirements.txt`
3. Run `quarto preview` to view the book locally
